Jim's cabin is a beautiful spot on 4 acres with everything you could need for a relaxing stay. He met us upon arrival & gave us a helpful tour of the cabin. There's plenty of lounging space on the 3 deck/patio areas with benches, chairs & tables. We loved eating on the little deck off the kitchen. There's a stocked pond out back & up a hill that's great for fishing & even a fire pit & little grill out back. If you plan on walking much I'd bring long pants and closed shoes. We saw deer trails, a great big raccoon, tons of birds, frogs, and a snake hole or two. The bed upstairs was very comfortable. If you're looking to get away from the busyness of life, this is perfect. It's comfortable and has all the basics provided for. There is heat & AC, a full kitchen, washer & dryer, 2 full baths, & an extra dining/game space in the basement with bedroom #2. Wifi and TV are available but it's just too pretty and peaceful to want to spend much time indoors. The cabin is just a few feet away from Route 350 so it's a little noisy with traffic during the day but the sense of space and privacy otherwise more than make up for that. And if you live in town it's still vastly more quiet than you'd be accustomed to. There was very little traffic at night.
We hope to be back! This is our favorite place we've stayed in!
